reference.title: FPSCR, Floating-Point Status and Control Register
reference.shortdesc: The FPSCR provides floating-point system status information and control.

dd.p: Floating-point Negative condition code flag.
Set to 1 if a floating-point comparison operation produces a less than result.
Floating-point Zero condition code flag.
Set to 1 if a comparison operation produces an equal result.
Floating-point Carry condition code flag.
Set to 1 if a comparison operation produces an equal, greater than, or unordered result.
Floating-point Overflow condition code flag.
Set to 1 if a comparison operation produces an unordered result.
Cumulative saturation bit.
This bit is set to 1 to indicate that an Advanced SIMD integer operation has saturated after 0 was last written to this bit.
Alternative Half-Precision control bit:

dlentry.dd: IEEE half-precision format selected. This is the reset value.

dd.p: Default NaN mode control bit:

dlentry.dd: operands propagate through to the output of a operation. This is the reset value.
Any operation involving one or more s returns the Default .

dd.p: The value of this bit only controls arithmetic. AArch32 arithmetic always uses the Default setting, regardless of the value of the DN bit.
Flush-to-zero mode control bit:

dlentry.dd: Flush-to-zero mode disabled. Behavior of the system is fully compliant with the IEEE 754 standard. This is the reset value.

dd.p: The value of this bit only controls arithmetic. arithmetic always uses the Flush-to-zero setting, regardless of the value of the FZ bit.
Rounding Mode control field:

dlentry.dd: Round to Nearest (RN) mode. This is the reset value.

dd.p: The specified rounding mode is used by almost all instructions. arithmetic always uses the setting, regardless of the value of the ode bits.
Flush-to-zero mode control bit on half-precision data-processing instructions:

dlentry.dd: Flush-to-zero mode disabled. Behavior of the system is fully compliant with the IEEE 754 standard.

dd.p: Input Denormal cumulative exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Input Denormal has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.
Inexact cumulative bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Inexact has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.
Underflow cumulative bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Underflow has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.
Overflow cumulative bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Overflow has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.
Division by Zero cumulative bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Division by Zero has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.
Invalid Operation cumulative bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Invalid Operation has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

dlentry.dd:
There is one copy of this register that is used in both Secure and Non-secure states.
The named fields in this register map to the equivalent fields in the AArch64 FPCR and FPSR. See FPCR, Floating-point Control RegisterThe FPCR controls behavior. and FPSR, Floating-point Status RegisterThe FPSR provides system status information..

section.title: Usage constraints

dd.p: To access the FPSCR:
dd.codeblock: VMRS <Rt>, FPSCR ; Read FPSCR into Rt VMSR FPSCR, <Rt> ; Write Rt to FPSCR

section.p: Register access is encoded as follows:
section.note: The CortexA76 core implementation does not support the deprecated VFP short vector feature. Attempts to execute the associated data-processing instructions result in an UNDEFINED Instruction .

dlentry.dd: This register is accessible as follows:

section.p: Access to this register depends on the values of CPACR_EL1.FPEN, CPTR_EL2.FPEN, CPTR_EL2.TFP, CPTR_EL3.TFP, and HCR_EL2.{E2H, TGE}. For details of which values of these fields allow access at which Exception levels, see the Arm Architecture Reference Manual Armv8, for Armv8-A architecture profile.
